Abstract.AbstractText: Acute mild respiratory SARS-CoV-2 infection can lead to a more chronic cognitive syndrome known as "COVID fog." New findings from Fernández-Castañeda et al. reveal how glial dysregulation and consequent neural circuit dysfunction may contribute to cognitive impairments in long COVID.
